list_definition.definition: a small board with a clip at the top for holding paper in place so that you can write on it while you are standing or moving around

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: A government safety inspector arrived, clutching a clipboard in his hand.

list_definition.definition: a part of a computer’s memory that stores information temporarily while you are moving it from one document to another

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: You can copy the text to your clipboard and paste it anywhere in your document.

list_ex_of_english: I do not know whether he used a clipboard; it is more likely that he got someone else to carry out the survey, and perhaps they used a clipboard.
Then the man with the clipboard comes and ticks off all the improvements that the occupier has made to the property over, perhaps, 20 years.
As soon as the block of leaseholds was bought, the new owners sent around a man with a clipboard—a surveyor—to look around the properties and make notes.
Clipix allows users to save online content and other documents to private or public clipboards.
Knowing the keystrokes, mouse actions, display, clipboard etc. used on one computer will not subsequently help an attacker gain access to the protected resource.
Upon arriving at the hospital, he finds a clipboard with his name on it, even though he has never been a patient there.
When data is added to the clipboard by an application, it typically makes it available in as many different data formats as it can.
The program can be set to minimize automatically after a period of idle time and clears the clipboard.
